results.title: Eraserhead
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, American Film Institute and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: Lynch’s debut film has been re-released with a new print and stereo mix soundtrack. Opinion is divided as to film’s brilliance but over the years it has achieved cult status in it’s genre. Shot in black and white with an incredible soundtrack and tight script, ‘Eraserhead’ is the story of a timid printer Henry Spencer (John Nance) who lives in an apartment building trying to figure out what to do with his horribly mutated son. Lynch described the film as ” a dream of dark and troubling things.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Lynch, American Film Institute and Lynch/Frost Productions

results.title: Queen Margot = La Reine Margot
results.creator_credit: Patrice Chereau, Claude Berri, D.A. Films, France Z Cinema and Renn Productions
results.brief_description: A lavish production set in France in 1572 when French Catholic and Protestants were at war. Catherine de Medici, mother of King Charles IX, arranges a political marriage between her daughter Margot and the French Protestant King of Navarre, Henri. Thousands of Protestant flock to Paris for the wedding and are butchered in the infamous St. Bartholmew massacre. Margot takes a Protestant lover, La Mole, but the repercussions of the massacre are destined to tear them apart. Isabelle Adjani is excellent as the sensuous, strong-willed Margot while Daniel Auteil is La Mole. Italian actress Virna Lisa plays the evil Catherine de Medici. Spoken in French and subtitled in English.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrice Chereau, Claude Berri, D.A. Films, France Z Cinema and Renn Productions

results.title: Pink Floyd - The Wall
results.creator_credit: Allan Parker, Gerald Scarfe, Alan Marshall, Goldcrest and Tin Blue
results.brief_description: Pink Floyd’s landmark album was translated into an original rock music motion picture experience. Bob Geldof plays Pink, a burnt out rock superstar who thinks he is going mad inside a room at a Los Angeles hotel. The film takes us on a downward spiral into Pink’s hell. Live action is intercut with brilliant animation by Gerald Scarfe and the soundtrack by Pink Floyd has given this film its cult status.

results.title: Beethoven lives upstairs
results.creator_credit: David Devine, Richard Mozer, Classical Prod for Children and Eros Financial Investments
results.brief_description: Christoph deeply resents the eccentric new tenant who has moved in upstairs and has turned his home upside-down. Slowly he begins to understand the genius of the man, the torment of his deafness and the beauty of his music, for the tenant is none other than Ludwig Van Beethoven. Set in 19th. century Vienna, this is a lavish production and features excerpts of Beethoven’s best loved works.

results.title: Batman
results.creator_credit: Tim Burton, Jon Peters, Peter Guber, Guber-Peters Company and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the comic book character created by Bob Kane, this “Batman” reflects the darkness of the original syndication and in no way resembles the 1960’s successful television series of the same name. Michael Keaton is Batman and Jack Nicholson portrays “The Joker”, his arch enemy. The sets are dark, gigantic and forbidding and the finale is set amongst a cathedral backdrop reminiscent of the set of “The Hunchback of Notre Dame”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tim Burton, Jon Peters, Peter Guber, Guber-Peters Company and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Enter the dragon
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse, Fred Weintraub, Paul Heller, Concorde Productions and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: One of the biggest martial arts epics ever filmed. Bruce Lee, determined to avenge the murder of his sister, enters the island fortress of crime warlord Han. Lee staged his own fighting sequences in the movie and the sequences are thrilling in their timing and execution. ‘Enter the dragon’ was Lee’s last film and his untimely death at a young age, a few weeks after the film’s completion had made this a landmark film of its genre.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Clouse, Fred Weintraub, Paul Heller, Concorde Productions and Warner Bros Pictures

results.title: Raising Arizona
results.creator_credit: Joel Coen, Ethan Coen, Ben Barenholtz, Circle Films, Jim Pedas and Ted Pedas
results.brief_description: A pacy black comedy about a quirky couple who resort to kidnapping when nature fails to give them a baby. Hi (Nicholas Cage) and Edwina (Holly Hunter) decide to kidnap one of the famous Arizona quintuplets and in doing so trigger a wild chase across the country. Co-starring John Goodman and William Forsythe.

results.title: Silent movie
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Michael Hertzberg, Crossbow and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Only one word of dialogue, (spoken by Marcel Marceau), in this Mel Brooks satire. Brooks portrays a director who comes up with a radical idea to save an ailing movie studio. He and his cronies band together to make a silent movie. Filled with slapstick gags reminiscent of the original silent classics, “Silent movie” features cameo appearances from a star studded cast including Mel Brooks, Marty Feldman, Dom DeLuise, Sid Caesar and Bernadette Peters.

results.title: Roxanne
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Daniel Melnick, Michael Rachmil and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A modern version of the Cyranno De Bergerac story starring Steve Martin and Daryl Hannah, directed by Fred Schepisi. Small town fire chief C.D. Bales falls in love with a new arrival to the town; an astronomer called Roxanne. He possesses a large nose which stands in the way of his attaining happiness, but eventually true love triumphs in this heartwarming tale.

results.title: Hombre
results.creator_credit: Martin Ritt, Irving Ravetch and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Paul Newman is the hero in this exciting, hard hitting western. John Russell is a white man raised as an Apache who faces the prejudices of a society which despises him. He is made to sit outside the stage coach by the white passengers who soon find that their lives are dependent on the man they rejected when outlaws leave them stranded in the desert. Co-starring Diane Cilento, Frederic March, Richard Boone and Barbara Rush.
